5.2. Connecting

Contents

  1. Connecting to a Database
  2. Changing the Database Engine

Connecting to a Database

A connection to a database is made through a URI passed to the constructor. 

 // connect
 $dbh = new CMMySQL("mysql://bob:abc123@localhost/mydb");
 if($dbh->isErrors())
   die("Could not connect to the database: " . $dbh->printErrors());

Changing the Database Engine

As long as your SQL statements and various other coding is compatible with a different daatabase engine you can change your whole project by simply issuing a different class and URI. So from the example above: 

 // connect
 $dbh = new CMOracle("oracle://bob:abc123@localhost/mydb");
 if($dbh->error())
   die("Could not connect to the database: " . $dbh->error());
